subject: Re: Anyone else offended by C2C?
author: ourobouros2k2
full_text:
The information was featured in the book "Strange Frequencies" by Craig Telesha, and is also a key point in Jeff Belanger's "History of ITC" lecture. You can also hear Mr. Belanger discuss it on his darkness radio podcast on 4/13/08, just go to darknessradio.com and go to the archive page.

There are many short, 1 paragraph blurbs on the subject (too many to list), just google Bogoras and EVP. For a more in-depth article on the man himself, check out

http://www.mnsu.edu/emuseum/information/biography/abcde/bogoras_waldemar.html

http://onlinebooks.library.upenn.edu/webbin/book/lookupname?key=Bogoras,%20Waldemar,%201865-1936

thanks
Andy

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, David Koenig <floridajakeblues@...> wrote:
>
> Can you point me to the Siberian tribe information. I'm very interested!
> ThanksDave
> 
> On Thu, Oct 1, 2009 at 8:18 AM, phenom_investigator <
> phenom_investigator@...> wrote:
> 
> >
> >
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>,
> > "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@> wrote:
> > >
> > > EVP itself defies categorization. Some folks think it is a modulated em
> > field in proximity to the microphone. There is evidence to support this, as
> > evp has been recorded in faraday cages and vacuum jars. It would then be
> > logical to assume that evp is independent of vibratory sound waves. Then
> > that is blown to hell when you consider that Waldemar Bogoras is credited
> > with the first reported evp capture while recording rituals of the Tchoutki
> > tribe in Siberia in 1901. The was with a mechanical gramaphone-like device,
> > no microphone, just a horn to amplify sound, mechanical "write" needle, and
> > wax cylinder. Electric gramaphones didn't come about till almost the '20s.
> > In that case it would appear that evp exists as soundwaves and not em
> > fields.
> > >
> > > Which one is right? Both probably, and that isn't even taking into
> > account the mechanism involved in box-related evp.
> > >
> > > Intent and desire to communicate. The rest works itself out.
> > >
> > > Thanks
> > > Andy
> > >
> >
> > And all of this supports the notion that the real underlying principle is
> > actually psychokinesis, most likely of the operator but possibly of some
> > external agent as well. This would not require any external 'power' in the
> > sense we normally think of it, and would explain why such voices are
> > recorded in powered and non-powered devices all using various recording
> > media. It would also explain the presence of audio and video since PK
> > appears to be an ability to affect the environment with the mind, which
> > could extend to manipulating or creating video and audio signals.
> >
> > In this context, conducting (or perhaps more correctly replicating) tests
> > in Faraday cages makes sense; in that one could then rule out anything
> > electromagnetic as a potential source. It may or may not be the case that
> > the sweep signal is critical to voice production. This is actually a notion
> > that needs further clarification - the presence of noise seems beneficial,
> > but is it required? Finding voices inside a Faraday cage in a replicated
> > test would actually be a very helpful outcome to advancing the research.
> >
> >  
> >
>
